update.description:
Adds an ign-gui plugin that displays an image received via an ignition transport topic. It uses the dummy_demo, so pull request #9 should be merged first, then this PR should be targeted at default.

To see it work:

* `IGN_GUI_PLUGIN_PATH=src/gui/ ./src/gazebo`
* `GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH=examples/dummy_demo/systems/ ./examples/dummy_demo/dummy_demo`

Unknowns

* How to give information to ignition-gui plugins? For example, how would this plugin know what topic to connect to? Right now it is hardcoded to /rendering/image.
* Can an ECS system load ignition-gui plugins? What would an ECS gui system look like?
* Is it ok to call ignition::gui::loadPlugin() from whatever thread the ECS system runs in?
update.title: Plugin to display image using ign-gui

pull_request.title: Plugin to display image using ign-gui

content.raw: All 4 of these calls have different indentation/closing paren conventions. I'm not sure if we care about this in CMake files, but I thought I would point it out.
content.html: All 4 of these calls have different indentation/closing paren conventions. I'm not sure if we care about this in CMake files, but I thought I would point it out.

content.raw:
Do the ignition libraries use the same style guide as Gazebo? If so, should this be `this->img.data()`?

There are 3 more instances of this in the next 5 lines
content.html:
Do the ignition libraries use the same style guide as Gazebo? If so, should this be this->img.data()?

There are 3 more instances of this in the next 5 lines

content.raw: Maybe determine the topic programmatically with `Node::SubscribedTopics()`? But maybe that would get called too often and introduce overhead.
content.html: Maybe determine the topic programmatically with Node::SubscribedTopics()? But maybe that would get called too often and introduce overhead.
